importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners in the ALCS, forcing Game 7 and marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe of the game and the ALCS outcome, which has direct implications for the National League Championship and the World Series.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, contributing significantly to the Blue Jays' 6-2 victory over the Mariners.
The Seattle Mariners made a critical error in the second inning, with two consecutive fielding mistakes leading to early runs.
Toronto's victory forces a Game 7 in the ALCS, the second time the Blue Jays have reached such a stage since 1985.
The Blue Jays will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 set for Friday.
Seattle's season-high three errors, including two in quick succession, undermined their chances and led to the decisive win.
Josh Naylor's homer and a single by Randy Arozerana briefly tied the game, but the Blue Jays' dominance in later innings sealed the outcome.
Mariners' pitcher Yesevage delivered a strong performance, throwing 31 splitters and striking out seven, showcasing composure and control in high-pressure moments.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a key hitter for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run in the postseason, a pivotal performance that helped the Blue Jays secure a 6-2 victory over the Mariners and force Game 7 in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS and marking their first such scenario since 1985.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They were defeated 6-2 by the Blue Jays, resulting in a Game 7 in the ALCS — their first time reaching that stage in franchise history.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The postseason series in Major League Baseball that determines the American League representative for the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The game result forced a Game 7 in the ALCS, a significant milestone in the 2025 postseason.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The winner of the ALCS will face the Dodgers in the 2025 World Series, beginning on Friday.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a key player for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a fielding error in the second inning, allowing a run to score and contributing to the Mariners’ early deficit.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a fielding error by Julio Rodríguez, initiating the Mariners' early run in the game.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that resulted in a fielding error by Eugenio Suárez, enabling a run to score.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a third baseman for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He made a critical error in fielding a groundball, allowing a run to score and contributing to the Mariners’ early deficit.

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a two-run homer in the second inning, helping the Blue Jays open with a 2-0 lead.

namedEntities.name: Isiah Kiner-Falefa
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a back-to-back RBI single with Barger, extending Toronto’s early lead.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a home run in the sixth inning, giving the Mariners a brief lead.

namedEntities.name: Randy Arozerana
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a batter for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a single that knocked out Trey Yesavage after 87 pitches, contributing to a temporary score.

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a pitcher for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched through 87 pitches and was pulled early in the game after a single by Arozerana, marking a critical moment in the game.

namedEntities.name: Louis Varland
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a relief pitcher for the Seattle Mariners.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He entered the game to face Suárez, who singled to score Arozerana from first base.

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball player, a pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He threw a wild pitch in the seventh inning, allowing Vladimir Guerrero Jr. to score and extend the lead to 6-2.

namedEntities.name: John Schneider
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Manager of the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He expressed pride in the team’s performance, noting that the win was special but grounded in game-by-game effort.

namedEntities.name: Dan Wilson
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He criticized the team’s fielding errors, attributing them to poor ball handling and loss of control in the second inning.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, powering the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners and forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The game was marked by a season-high three fielding errors by the Mariners — including two consecutive mistakes in the second inning — which allowed early runs and shifted momentum. Despite a brief rally with a home run from Josh Naylor and a single by Randy Arozerana, the Blue Jays’ dominance, led by Guerrero Jr.'s performance and solid pitching from Trey Yesavage, sealed the win. The Blue Jays, who have not advanced to a Game 7 since 1985, now face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
